intro: Oncoba brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed sycamore, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often deeply lobed. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in panicles and bloom in the spring. Oncoba brevipes produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in moist, lowland areas.
